title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisite: NilIntroduction and nomenclature; Structure and stereochemistry of monosaccharides; The sugars in solution; Conformation of sugars. Reactions at the anomeric center; Reactions at the non anomeric centers. Protecting groups relevant to carbohydrates. Anhydro-, amino-, thio-, unsaturated- and branched-chain sugars. Total synthesis of other natural products from sugar chirons. Complex Glycosides, carbohydrate antibiotics; carbohydrates on cell surfaces; oligosaccharides with biological relevance; glycolysis; introduction to inositol.Books: 1) Monosaccharides: Their Chemistry and Role in Natural Products, P.M. Collins,and R.J. Ferrier, 1995, Wiley, New York. ISBN: 0-47195343-1 ; Carbohydrates-Structure and Biology, J. Lehmann, 1998, Thieme, New York, ISBN: 3-13-110771-5.
